ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think I can manage a 2 part post-- but i m sure i ll try some time soon! Remember what School House Rocky said-- Knowledge is Power!! I have yet to
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think I can manage a 2 part post-- but
i'm sure i'll try some time soon! Remember what
School House Rocky said-- "Knowledge is Power!!" I have
yet to play an Erudite or a human from Qeynos, so
those chars and their quests will actually be very new
for me, as would an Iksar (i've only played around
with it a bit). <br><br>EQ is great at offering those
of us who have played a bit a "born-again-newbie"
option with the new expansions. Val-Shir?? It will be
all new if you want it to-- BUT... <br><br>the EQ
world experience will still be there, so you won't
freak out the first time a 2d spider joins in the fight
and hits you from behind. I remember jumping in my
seat, shouting out loud, and running around trying to
remember which way to my city zone (newbie gnome in
Steamfont). I didn't even leave Steamfont for 9 levels
because I was afraid to zone. I can still remember the
feeling when I first got on the boat to FP--- now I hate
taking any boat and pay to avoid it!!!! <br>You know how
to hit the F9 key to see what's going on, how to
stay safe in certain zones, how to get away from a bad
situation, basic fighting/flight stragegies. <br><br>But now
we'll have horses, and the whole world will be bright
and new. Next year we'll have mermen/mermaids and
we'll all be riding seahorses and learning underwater
fighting tactics. <br><br>I can't wait too see the first
lvl 2 Val-Shir bard in full lambent armor. I'm saving
my /bird for that one!!!<br><br>X.
